module.name: simtoolloader
module.description: Loads objects, tools and a table on the simulator.
module.copypolicy: Released under the terms of the GNU GPL v2.0
module.description-long: This module helps creating different tools and objects on the simulator. Tools will be created on the robot hand matching the 'tool grasp' orientation provided by the Actions Rendering Engine module. Objects will be created on a table also created on front of the robot so that they can be interacted with. Models have to be installed from the folder ./app/models Indices corresponding to each model can be found and changed on simtoolloader.ini, which is installed from ./app/conf

param.desc: Sub-path from \c $ICUB_ROOT/app to the configuration file

input.description: Takes the following RPC commands from Human or manager -# del: Deletes all previously created objects (tools, objects and table) from the simulator -# move : Moves object to original position on the table, slightly to the front and the right, without regenerating it. -# obj (int) objI: Creates table and object 'objI' on the table on front of the iCub. -# tool (int) objI (int) toolI (int)toolOrient: Creates table, object 'objI' on the table, and tool 'toolI' on the hand of the iCub oriented 'toolOrient' degrees w.r.t to the frontal position. (refer to simtoolloader.ini for the list of tools). Note: tool orientation is only set correctly if the hand is in front of the iCub, around coordinates (-0.25,0.15,0.05) and oriented towards the iCub bisector plane, i.e. towards the center.

dependencies.computer: icubSim and simCartesianController have to be running.
